feed.title: Lions Gate to split studio and Starz into separate entities
feed.summary: Lions Gate Entertainment Corp. is approved by the Supreme Court of British Columbia to split its Studio and STARZ businesses into two distinct publicly-traded companies. The separation is expected to complete on Tuesday, with Lionsgate Studios, valued at $2.06 billion, commencing trading on the NYSE under the ticker LION on Wednesday. This strategic move aims to allow each business to focus on its core strengths and adapt to the evolving entertainment industry.

feed.title: LIONSGATE AND LIONSGATE STUDIOS REMIND SHAREHOLDERS TO VOTE AT THE UPCOMING MEETINGS AND ANNOUNCE PROXY SUPPLEMENT
feed.summary: Lionsgate (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B) and Lionsgate Studios (Nasdaq: LION) are reminding shareholders to vote at their upcoming annual general and special meetings on April 23, 2025. The companies are seeking approval to separate Lionsgate Studios' motion picture and television studio operations from Lionsgate's other businesses, including the STARZ platforms. They also announced a proxy supplement filing and recommend shareholders vote "FOR" all proposals.

feed.title: Lionsgate Nears Separation Of Studio And Starz
feed.summary: Lionsgate is moving closer to separating Lionsgate Studios and Starz, having filed an amended registration statement with the SEC. The joint proxy is expected to be declared effective soon, after which a special shareholder meeting will be set. This follows the spin-out of Lionsgate Studios in the past year and an extension of the theatrical output deal with Starz, as both entities aim for independent growth.

feed.title: Activist investor Anson takes stake in Lionsgate Studios, may push for sale, Bloomberg News reports
feed.summary: Activist investor Anson Funds Management has acquired a stake in Lionsgate Studios and is urging the company to explore strategic options, including a potential sale, according to Bloomberg News. This move comes as Lionsgate faces corporate governance issues and box-office underperformance. Anson Funds believes the studio is undervalued and suggests considering divestitures, alternative revenue streams, and improved financial disclosures.

feed.title: Lionsgate Studios and Starz Take Another Step Toward Separation With New Company Names
feed.summary: Lionsgate has filed a Form S-4 Registration Statement with the SEC as part of its ongoing process to separate its studio division from STARZ. This move will result in pre-transaction shareholders holding shares in two new entities: Starz Entertainment Corp. and Lionsgate Studios Corp. The separation, which has been in the works for over a year and is expected to be completed by the end of 2024, aims to deliver incremental value to stakeholders.

feed.title: Lionsgate Closing In On Studio-Starz Split
feed.summary: Lionsgate is moving closer to its planned split of the studio and Starz, evidenced by an SEC filing that officially outlines the transaction. This split aims to create two separate publicly traded companies, Lionsgate Studios and Starz Entertainment, allowing each to pursue distinct operating priorities. The new Starz Entertainment will also undergo a 15-to-1 reverse stock split to consolidate common shares.

feed.title: Lionsgate Files Regulatory Paperwork Separating Studio Business From Starz
feed.summary: Lionsgate has filed regulatory paperwork with the SEC to separate its studio business into a new company, Lionsgate Studios Corp., from its Starz multiplatform media business, which will be Starz Entertainment Corp. Current Lionsgate shareholders will own separate shares (LION and STRZ) in each company. This separation, which requires shareholder approval, follows Lionsgate reporting a net loss of $163.3 million on revenue of $948.6 million in its most recent fiscal period.

feed.title: White & Case Has Advised Screaming Eagle Acquisition Corp. on its US$4.6 Billion Business Combination with Lionsgate’s Studio Business and Related US$350 Million Financing
feed.summary: White & Case LLP advised Screaming Eagle Acquisition Corp. on its US$4.6 billion business combination with Lionsgate's studio business, creating Lionsgate Studios Corp., a new publicly-traded content company. The firm also advised on a related US$350 million financing. Lionsgate Studios' shares began trading on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "LION" on May 14, 2024.

feed.title: Lionsgate Studios to Start Trading on Nasdaq
feed.summary: Lionsgate Studios is set to begin trading as a standalone film and TV studio business on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol LION, separate from Lionsgate's Starz business. The transaction is expected to raise $350 million and is part of a larger plan to fully separate the studio and Starz businesses by the end of 2024. The new entity combines Lionsgate’s Motion Picture Group and Television Studio business, along with its extensive film and TV library.
